rename.from: `@EnabledIf` and `@DisabledIf` fail to locate external condition method in OSGi framework
rename.to: `@EnabledIf` and `@DisabledIf` fail to locate external class in OSGi framework

body: @chrisr3, I created this issue to track the additional use case you are covering in #3280, but it appears that I cannot _assign_ it to you.

issue.title: Introduce `tryToLoadClass(String, ClassLoader)` in `ReflectionSupport`

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: ✅ The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

To align with similar issues aiming to provide better support for using a custom `ClassLoader`, we should introduce `tryToLoadClass(String, ClassLoader)` in `ReflectionSupport` which delegates to `ReflectionUtils.tryToLoadClass(String, ClassLoader)`.

## Related Issues

- #1987
- #2104
- #3279
- #3290 
- #3291 
- #3292

rename.from: `@EnabledIf` and `@DisabledIf` fail to locate external class in OSGi framework
rename.to: `@EnabledIf` and `@DisabledIf` fail to locate external class with custom `ClassLoader` arrangement

body:
**Update**:

Work on this issue is complete; however, I cannot push to `main` due to a `protected branch hook` blocking me.

We will investigate the cause for that. In the interim, the completed work can be viewed here:

https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/compare/main...sbrannen:junit5:issues/3279_and_3292_custom_ClassLoader_arrangements
